publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3582 John Park: Go4SET—That the Parliament recognises and supports the ongoing work of the Go4SET (go for science, engineering and technology) national programme, led by the Engineering Development Trust, in helping talented young people achieve their potential in engineering, science and technology careers; applauds the hard work and effort of the students of all the participating schools in developing their excellent projects in the area of sustainable engineering, as recognised at the Go4SET Edinburgh Celebration and Assessment Day, held on 24 February 2009 at the University of Edinburgh, and congratulates Balerno High School on being awarded the Best Overall Project award and Dollar High School for receiving the Innovation award.
S3M-3582 Go4SET (lodged on 2 March 2009) Jamie Hepburn*

S3M-3582 Go4SET (lodged on 2 March 2009) Ken Macintosh*, Kenneth Gibson*, Mike Pringle*, Robin Harper*, Stuart McMillan*, David Stewart*, Liam McArthur*, Des McNulty*, David Whitton*, Jackie Baillie*, Alasdair Allan*, Sarah Boyack*, Bill Kidd*, Jamie McGrigor*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Mary Mulligan*, Mr Frank McAveety*

*S3M-3582 John Park: Go4SET—That the Parliament recognises and supports the ongoing work of the Go4SET (go for science, engineering and technology) national programme, led by the Engineering Development Trust, in helping talented young people achieve their potential in engineering, science and technology careers; applauds the hard work and effort of the students of all the participating schools in developing their excellent projects in the area of sustainable engineering, as recognised at the Go4SET Edinburgh Celebration and Assessment Day, held on 24 February 2009 at the University of Edinburgh, and congratulates Balerno High School on being awarded the Best Overall Project award and Dollar High School for receiving the Innovation award. Supported by: Marilyn Livingstone*, Cathie Craigie*, Trish Godman*, James Kelly*, Hugh Henry*, Claire Baker*, Johann Lamont*, Gil Paterson*

S3M-3582 John Park: Go4SET—That the Parliament recognises and supports the ongoing work of the Go4SET (go for science, engineering and technology) national programme, led by the Engineering Development Trust, in helping talented young people achieve their potential in engineering, science and technology careers; applauds the hard work and effort of the students of all the participating schools in developing their excellent projects in the area of sustainable engineering, as recognised at the Go4SET Edinburgh Celebration and Assessment Day, held on 24 February 2009 at the University of Edinburgh, and congratulates Balerno High School on being awarded the Best Overall Project award and Dollar High School for receiving the Innovation award. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Ken Macintosh, Kenneth Gibson, Mike Pringle, Robin Harper, Stuart McMillan, David Stewart, Liam McArthur, Des McNulty, David Whitton, Jackie Baillie, Alasdair Allan, Sarah Boyack, Bill Kidd, Jamie McGrigor, Hugh O’Donnell, Mary Mulligan, Mr Frank McAveety, Marilyn Livingstone, Cathie Craigie, Trish Godman, James Kelly, Hugh Henry, Claire Baker, Johann Lamont, Gil Paterson, Jack McConnell*
S3M-3582 Go4SET (lodged on 2 March 2009) Charlie Gordon*, Bob Doris*
S3M-3582 Go4SET (lodged on 2 March 2009) Rhoda Grant*
S3M-3582 Go4SET (lodged on 2 March 2009) Karen Whitefield*
S3M-3582 Go4SET (lodged on 2 March 2009) Dr Richard Simpson*
